channel.title: Compiler Errors
channel.description:
[code]client.java:8193: 'catch' without 'try' } catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) { ^ NPCHandler.java:957: class, interface, or enum expected if (npcs[i].npcType == 2633) ^ NPCHandler.java:962: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Source : TestScape
Also, i've added myself as an Admin in client.java, but the compiling seems to have errors - In-game, i'm not a admin, could this be the reason?
Anything else you need to know, just ask.
Cheers
Sam[br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2007, 01:21:41 PM[/size][hr]Does anyone know?
Also, besides the compiling errors, sometimes when i try and talk to NPC's, it either says i need a rod and bait, or, simply nothing will happen.
Anyone got some advise / fix?
Cheers
Sam

item.title: Compiler Errors
item.dc:creator: @Leumas Leumas
item.description:
@Leumas wrote:

System79:

as i said, the error is not in there

Thanks for the tip - Seems like you understand / know my problem.

Any solutions?

[quote=“kestral, post:7, topic:68153”]Just to clarify i copied your admin thing into mine and it worked fine just add a “}” where i put my star [quote author=Leumas link=topic=99607.msg1019692#msg1019692 date=1174079454]

[code] //start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Leumas”))
{
playerRights = 3;

			}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Leumas”))
{
playerRights = 2;
*
[/code]
[/quote][/quote]

Cheers! I’ll go try it, and i’ll post back with the results.

Sam[br][size=1]Posted on: March 16, 2007, 12:46:08 PM[/size][hr]Nope. Stilll get the SAME compiler errors, and still not an admin. >.>

Does anyone have ANY ideas?

Main issues : Admin, and compiler

Sub-issues : How do i get air staffs etc to work? And auto-cast? (Sorry, i just can’t use the search function, brings up silly, not-asked results)

Cheers,

Sam[br][size=1]Posted on: March 16, 2007, 01:17:53 PM[/size][hr]______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

OK.

I’ve tried to fix this myself seems that the forum is pretty slow / uninterested (No offence to anyone. :))

First Error

OK, the first error is:

client.java:8193: 'catch' without 'try' } catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) {

The EXACT line from the client.java :

} catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) { //destruct(); return;

Second Error

Compiler Error:

NPCHandler.java:957: class, interface, or enum expected if (npcs[i].npcType == 2633

The ACTUAL line from NPCHandler.java:

} if (npcs[i].npcType == 2633) {

Third Error

Compiler Error:

NPCHandler.java:962: class, interface, or enum expe }

NPCHandler.java line:

I can’t find anything for this one.

Might help someone.

I tried deleting these lines, but that caused more errors.

I don’t fully understand the lines, so i can’t fix them myself.

Cheers

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Errors
item.dc:creator: @tim_moughtin tim_moughtin
item.description:
@tim_moughtin wrote:

[quote=“Leumas, post:3, topic:68153”][code] //start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Leumas”))
{
playerRights = 3;

			}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Leumas”))
{
playerRights = 2;[/code]

I read on another thread/topic, that sometimes, setting your rights to “3” doesn’t work. So, i added myself twice.

I’ve tried it with playerRights = 3 on it’s own, and the same for playerRights = 2.

Neither works.

Ever since i’ve tried to become an admin on my own server, this problem persists.

Cheers

Sam[/quote]

make sure in your server it says somewhere admin=3 mod=2 etc.

otherwise your just telling the server random numbers

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Errors
item.dc:creator: @kestral kestral
item.description:
@kestral wrote:

ok just please give me a sec…

[code] //start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin”))
{
playerRights = 3;
}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Leumas”))
{
playerRights = 3;
}
[/code]

Try that

Neither works.
